results.title: Foster's release
results.creator_credit: Terence Winkless, Milton C. Hubatka and Verexal Productions
results.brief_description: A suspenseful drama about a girl who, while babysitting, is the victim of anonymous telephone calls. She tries to have the calls traced. In the taut climax the telephone company and the police work feverishly to reach the girl in time to avert a tragedy. Combines atmospheric music and good use of camera shots including long shots, overhead and close-ups.

results.title: [Return to Michigan]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Week”.
In 1976, tragedy struck the farmers at Michigan. A poisonous chemical, PBB, had been mixed into stock food, and all livestock had to be killed and the contamination was passed on through foods for human consumption causing much illness.

results.title: Material unaccounted for
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Week”.
Investigates the security of the nuclear plant at which Karen Silkwood worked before her mysterious death. Radioactive material had been placed in Ms. Silkwood’s home during the period in which she was campaigning against the working conditions and safety measures at the U.S. American plant.

results.title: Forum of protest
results.creator_credit: Gary Cunningham, Richard Linning and HSV7 Melbourne
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Week”.
Prompted by the statement by the then Victorian Premier, Sir Henry Bolte, to the effect that there would be no State Parliamentary House of Review within a generation, this television current affairs report dedicates itself to the history and protocol of the Victorian Legislative Council as well as the architectural features of its chambers. A fairly dry “talking heads” program.

results.title: Form in the making (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Julian Bates, Donald Douglas and Stockwell College of Education
results.brief_description: Follows the work of sculptor Alan Bransbury as he creates a sculpture of the madonna and child. Sequences of the conception, modeling, casting, delivery, and mounting of the sculpture help clarify the techniques and creative problems involved in producing a major work of sculpture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julian Bates, Donald Douglas and Stockwell College of Education

results.title: Form for function (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Artists at work in the Gustavberg pottery factory at Gustavberg, Sweden. We see how they design their work, how they find aesthetic and practical solutions to functional problems, and the fact that the way in which the finished article is used determines the design and form of the product. Many fine examples of Swedish pottery are included.

results.title: Form + function (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Erik Wernicke, Hans Ruths and Dido Films
results.brief_description: A series of comparisons between the industrial and domestic designs of the early 1900’s and their 1950-1960’s equivalents, in which form is determined by function. Includes examples of architectural and household appliance designs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Erik Wernicke, Hans Ruths and Dido Films

results.title: Forever James Dean
results.brief_description: A short documentary about the short career of screen legend James Dean. Features loads of stills, his first screen appearance for ‘Pepsi’ and clips and trailers of his three feature films: “East of Eden”, “Rebel without a cause” and “Giant”. Contains some contemporary interviews and features a song written for the film made in the 1980s. Narrated by Bob Gunton.
